intro: Aethionema edentulum, commonly known as the toothless rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding ornamental value to rocky or gravelly soils. Aethionema edentulum is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
